meanings.definition: Give or grant someone (power, status, or recognition)
meanings.sent1: She accords respect to all her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The manager accords promotions based on performance.
meanings.sent3: The magician accords special powers to his assistant.
meanings.sent4: The crown accords authority to the rightful king.
meanings.sent5: The teacher accords praise to hardworking students.

meanings.sent1: The two countries signed an accord for peace.
meanings.sent2: The accord between the companies brought mutual benefits.
meanings.sent3: The accord was celebrated with a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The accord acted as a bridge between the nations.
meanings.sent5: The accord was a symbol of unity and understanding.

meanings.sent1: There was a strong accord among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The family reached an accord on vacation plans.
meanings.sent3: The accord on pizza toppings was unanimous.
meanings.sent4: Their accord on the movie choice was surprising.
meanings.sent5: The accord in the room was palpable and comforting.
